candidates.title: QEMU target arch selector via feature flag
candidates.body: This allows us to write emulators based on libafl_qemu for a specific target arch

candidates.title: better forkserver example
candidates.body: This pr removes hardcoded paths from forkserver example, and use clap to make it look more decent

candidates.title: More LLVM passes from AFL++
candidates.body:
+ classic coverage (afl, ctx, ngram, kctx)
+ refactor libafl_targets to be compatible with afl++

candidates.title: Qemu fixes and syscalls for every supported arch
implemented MapMaxPow2Feedback
candidates.body: This adds a new feedback that only tracks new testcases if the edges count has at least a pow2 distance to the last

candidates.title: Add minibsod
candidates.body: Add's the minibsod bolt, which provides `mini-Blue Screen of Death` output on crashes, including register dump, backtrace and mappings.

candidates.title: remove unused const hashing mode
candidates.body: There's not really any reason to spend more time compiling.

candidates.title: Mutational Push Stage
candidates.body:
This PR will (eventually) create a Mutational Push Stage that doesn't call an executor for each generated input, but instead returns the next testcase as iterator.
The caller of the push stage must make sure they execute the returned testcase, and that their harness populates the observers, as well as the `exit_kind`.

candidates.title: Fork feature flag to disable fork in Launcher
candidates.body: This allows us to disable fork when using Restarting Mgr and Launcher, for use cases that don't support `fork` (such as threaded applications)

candidates.title: Bridge grammartec from Nautilus to libafl
Gramatron
candidates.body: I'm implementing an enhanced version of Gramatron (http://hexhive.epfl.ch/publications/files/21ISSTA.pdf) able to stack mutations.

candidates.title: Frida Address Sanitizer for x86_64
candidates.body:
still WIP.
but I just thought ci would help, so I put it here as a draft pr

- TODOs
- [x] handle_trap for amd64
- [x] the speed issue of hook_func
- [x] blob_report for amd64
- [x] Get https://github.com/tokatoka/frida-rust merged, this repo extends frida-rust for some missing instructions on amd64 (PR submitted)

candidates.title: don't include all of libafl for symcc_runtime by default
candidates.body: Just to avoid adding unnecessary dependencies. It's quite annoying when the build takes very long for dependencies that are not even used...

candidates.title: Qemu new syscall hook and more python API
Still fixing CI
candidates.body: This PR works on fixing CI in `main`

candidates.title: Atheris example to fuzz Python Code
candidates.body:
This is an example how to use LibAFL together with Google's Atheris.
Run `make short_test` in `fuzzers/libafl_atheris` to see it move.

frida_libpng runs on windows. (with mingw-64)
The changes are mostly cfg guards.
